intro: Oxydectes martii, commonly known as the Mexican fireweed, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its tall, erect stems and showy, red bracts that resemble flowers. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and covered in fine hairs. Oxydectes martii is often found in disturbed soils and thrives in full sun, making it a common sight in arid and semi-arid regions.
